entry.title: Re: Plan for migration of interfaces to SAP Cloud Integra...
entry.content:
Helo Ramu,

Based on my experience, I‚Äôd see the following:

(i) You might have multiple pipelines running in your tenant. Although I haven‚Äôt yet encountered a scenario with separate pipelines per team, I have seen multiple pipelines used for distinct messages with different priorities, or to segregate scenarios containing sensitive data. If teams should not see or operate on messages from other teams, then yes, that setup would be beneficial.

(ii) Normally, customers migrate system by system. However, this depends on whether you have single interfaces operating across multiple plants and whether that would have any operational impact.

(iii) There is no one-size-fits-all guidance here, especially for areas such as Resource Management. If you‚Äôll have multiple teams working within the same SAP Integration Suite tenant, it‚Äôs important to start with good governance and clearly define access policies, naming conventions, and related standards.

To stablish a good governance, I'd recommend to look at the ISA-M: https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-btp-guidance-framework/sap-integration-solution-advisory-methodology/sap-integration-solution-advisory-methodology-overview?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

More specifically for user accesses and policies, I'd recommend the links below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/configuring-user-access?version=CLOUD
https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/identity-and-access-management?version=CLOUD
https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/managing-access-policies?version=CLOUD


Finally, I'd recommend to take a look on the Migration Guide at the "Landscape" section, and also make sure test and get confidence how to operate with one or multiple pipelines. That will accelerate how you migrate interfaces in the long-term
https://help.sap.com/docs/migration-guide-po/migration-guide-for-sap-process-orchestration/migration-guide-sap-process-orchestration?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 Email Alert Configuration
entry.content:
It doesn't matter if you configure email settings in SLD or in General settings. The option to set it up in General settings only enables you to define it for each company separately, while SLD setup is valid for all companies on the server.

Regarding prerequisites, there are few:

1. Obviously you need to enable comminication between SLD and SMTP server via port that is used for SMTP (usually 587, but that is for you to know). What security layers you need to configure, that is also for you to know as it is your environment.

2. Your SMTP server needs to be enabled for third party apps connection. Might be a different name, but it's a setting that enables various apps to connect to SMTP and use it to send emails.

3. AlertSvc user (or Workflow on more recent versions) should not be locked, should be marked superuser and shuld have a default language selected (one of the system languages, not custom language).

4. When you connect to SMTP, you connect via certain user credentials that you set up in SLD, for example sld@test.com. Email address used for sending alerts is the one defined in company details, general tab. If these two emails are not the same, for example you set company@test.com in Company details, then you need to make sure that sld@test.com account has authorization to send emails on behalf of company@test.com. 

Never had an issue after I set all of these points up.

entry.title: Re: API or function to Reject CR of BP in MDG
entry.content:
@Kevin_zzj 

Here's another option to consider:

In the Rule-Based Workflow - within the Single Value Decision Table, add an additional row with the following configuration:

  • CR Previous Step: DS (Data Steward)
  • Previous Action: 04 (Reject)
  • New Change Request Step: 40
  • New CR Status: 01

Best regards,
Sandeep Suggu.

entry.title: Handling RFC Queue Errors in SAP EWM Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In SAP EWM Public Cloud, you can view and reprocess RFC queue errors directly from the Warehouse Monitor. Pending queues are visible there, and you can reprocess them once the underlying issue is resolved.

The real problem starts when the error has no actual fix. For example, an inbound delivery that was already put away, but the logistics period was afterward shifted. This leaves you with an RFC error you cannot resolve, and when you open the queue details there is no option to influence the data container, such as adjusting the posting date. Rejecting the queue does not work either.

Transaction /SCWM/ERP_STOCKCHECK technically exists, but since the queue is still present, you cannot clean up the situation through that check. The only app that seems remotely comparable to transaction SQM2 is F5427 (Manage Queue), yet it does not display anything relevant here.

Question
How can these unresolvable RFC queue errors be corrected in SAP EWM Public Cloud?

Thanks

entry.title: Re: How do I add international freight and insurance cost...
entry.content:
Hello all,

We‚Äôve found a practical workaround to address this scenario. Instead of generating three separate POs‚Äîone each for material, freight, and customs/insurance‚Äîwe created a single international PO with two additional condition types for freight and insurance. At the creation stage, you‚Äôll need to enter estimated amounts for these charges, as exact figures are usually unavailable upfront. You can assign a different supplier to each condition type.

When performing goods receipt (GRN), all costs (material, freight, insurance) are added to the material value. Afterwards, you can reference this single PO to create three separate supplier invoices, each corresponding to the appropriate supplier. Since the actual freight cost is often determined only at invoicing, you can use the unplanned delivery cost field to adjust the amount during invoice posting.

Pros:

All charges (including those from multiple suppliers) are included in the material value.

There‚Äôs no need to create multiple POs, even though the option to split POs isn‚Äôt available (based on current research).

Cons:

If you issue or sell the material before invoicing, any subsequent cost adjustment will not update the inventory ledger, but instead be posted to the price difference (expense) ledger.

For supplier communications, you‚Äôll need to develop additional print forms to accommodate the new process.

Please refer to the following link for more clarification.

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/planned-delivery-cost-of-purchasing-in-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition/ba-p/13572608?utm_source=chatgpt.com

Best Regards,

Nithin

entry.title: Renewal of M-user / Tenant certificate in ByD
entry.content:
üîê M-User (Tenant / Client) Certificate Renewal for SAP Business ByDesign

Background

SAP will renew the M-User / Tenant / Client certificate used in SAP Business ByDesign (ByD) tenants
This certificate is used for secure communication, authentication, and system-to-system integrations where client certificate (X.509 / SSL) authentication is configured.

üìÖ Renewal Schedule

Environment Certificate Renewal Date
Test Tenants19 November 2025
Production Tenants03 December 2025

üîç Impact

This certificate renewal may impact integrations only if your landscape uses:

  • Direct certificate pinning

  • Stored M-User certificate in keystore

  • X.509 / SSL client certificate authentication

  • Communication Arrangement generated key pairs

‚úÖ No impact if:

  • Your system trusts SAP Cloud Root CA

  • Certificate validation is based on Subject / Issuer instead of the full certificate

  • No certificate pinning or X.509 authentication is used

‚ö†Ô∏è Action Required (Only if applicable)

1Ô∏è‚É£ If you have pinned/mapped the M-User certificate directly

üìå Example: Certificate uploaded to keystore or mapped to a user in ABAP/Java
Action:
Download the new certificate after renewal and update your system mapping.

2Ô∏è‚É£ If your system receives outbound calls from ByD using X.509 client certificate authentication

üìå Example: ByD calling customer ABAP or JAVA services
Action:
Update the renewed M-User certificate against the respective user in your system.

3Ô∏è‚É£ If your system calls ByD using a key pair generated from Communication Arrangement

üìå (Using ‚ÄúCreate / Download Key Pair‚Äù)
Action:
Generate a new key pair after certificate renewal and install it in the same location of your client system.

üß™ Recommended

Validate all integrations in Test tenants after 19 November 2025 before the Production certificate rotation.

üí¨ Support

For any questions or support, please open a ticket from your ByD system or contact SAP Support Hotline.

entry.title: Re: Fiori Elements list report controller extension typescript : editFlow().getView() does not work
entry.content:
@SumitKundu: as we both agree that EditFlow does not have the getView method, the line

this.oView = (this.base.getExtensionAPI().getEditFlow() as EditFlow).getView();

cannot work, as it calls EditFlow.getView().

I'm not even sure what this line is supposed to do: it tries to get the view and store it on "this", which is the ControllerExtension instance (ListReportExt, but inheriting from ControllerExtension). But the controller extension class does have a getView() method, so you should be able to write

this.oView = this.getView();

The TypeScript compiler should accept this. No need to cast anything. But why save oView at all, when getView() returns the view at any time?

entry.title: Building a Generative AI-powered Inventory Assistant with SAP CAP, RAG, and Vector Database
entry.content:
Introduction

In modern enterprises, inventory management is no longer just about tracking numbers ‚Äî it's about accessing the right information at the right time and enabling fast, data-driven decisions. Today, Generative AI offers a powerful opportunity to make these processes smarter, faster, and more intuitive.

In this project, I transformed a stock management application built with SAP CAP (Node.js) on SAP BTP into an intelligent decision assistant by integrating Generative AI, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) , and a vector database .

The application interprets natural language queries, finds relevant products using embedding-based similarity search , retrieves real records from the database, and ‚Äî thanks to the grounding approach ‚Äî generates responses strictly based on actual data. This prevents hallucinations and ensures a trusted enterprise AI experience.

A key learning resource for this development was the SAP Learning Journey
‚ÄúSolving Business Problems using SAP's Generative AI Hub‚Äù
which helped me explore and apply Generative AI concepts in real SAP BTP scenarios.

In this blog, I will walk through the architecture, implementation details, and the technical components behind this solution.

 

STEP 1:

We set up the Basic CAP file structure  with "cds init" in the terminal 

 

  • Creates package.json and config files

  • Prepares db, srv, app folders

And then .envwe define our Gemini API key in the file in the project root directory.

 

Then we create the "serice.cds and service.js" files under the "SRV" folder.

and we define "service.cds" as follows:

namespace ai;

using data from '../db/products';


type ChatTurn {
  role   : String;  
  content: String;
}

type ChatResponse {
  content : String;
}


service ProductService @(path:'/products') {
  entity Products as projection on data.Products;

}

service AIService @(path:'/ai') {
  : { method: 'POST', path: 'chat' }
  action chat(message: String, history: many ChatTurn) returns ChatResponse;

 
}

  • ChatTurn: Represents each line of conversation (role: user/assistant, content: message)

  • ChatResponse: Response format returned from chat (an object containing only content)

These structures are used for AI chat API .

 

And right below, we define a "product" service that exposes product data to the outside.

This section 

  • /productsvia endpoint

  • data.Productsshows his painting to the outside world

Just below this, we define the AI ‚Äã‚Äãservice .
This service is the structure that responds to user requests sent in natural language.

We created an action inside the service chatcalled . In the CAP world, action is used to execute special business logic outside of classic CRUD operations (CREATE/READ/UPDATE/DELETE).

This chataction:

  • message: text written by the user,

  • history: previous conversation history

takes and

  • ChatResponse: that is, the answer generated by artificial intelligence

returns.

In short, this action is the bridge between the UI side and the LLM. When
the user POST /ai/chatsubmits the request, the CAP service.jsruns the relevant code within it; it reads the product data, applies vector lookup and grounding, and then generates a response from the LLM.

 

After completing the service definition, we need to create the data model that will store the product data the application will use. This structure dbis defined in the CAP layer. Here, I defined an entity for the products and uploaded the initial data to the system via a CSV file.

In the data layer of the application, I defined three basic entities for inventory management and artificial intelligence operations:

namespace data;

entity Products {
  ID        : UUID @key;
  sku       : String(60) ;
  name      : String(200);
  price     : Decimal(15,2);
  currency  : String(3) default 'TRY';
  stock     : Integer default 0;
  category  : String(80);
  brand     : String(80);
  color     : String(40);
  barcode   : String(32);
  weight    : Decimal(10,3); 
  unit      : String(10) default 'adet';
  description: String(1000);
  createdAt : Timestamp default current_timestamp;
  updatedAt : Timestamp;
}

entity Embeddings {
  ID         : UUID @key;
  product    : Association to Products;
  chunkIndex : Integer;          
  text       : String(5000);    
  embedding  : LargeString;       
  model      : String(100);      
  dim        : Integer;       
  createdAt  : Timestamp default current_timestamp;
}

entity ProductVectors {
  sku       : String(60) @key;
  embedding : LargeString;
}

Products‚Äî Product Main Table

This table stores basic product information in the system.
Fields contain actual commercial parameters such as product name, price, and stock quantity.

Embeddings‚Äî Text Embedding Archive

This table is designed to store embeddings of product descriptions.
Embedding a product can be done by splitting it into multiple pieces of text, rather than as a single line.

ProductVectors‚Äî Fast Vector Lookup Table

This table holds a simplified version of the product SKU and embeddings.

For the project, I created a product dataset for testing purposes.
This CSV file contains basic product information used in the application's inventory query, embedding generation, and vector search processes.

We're using the CAP command to create the product and vector tables in the project deploy.
The following command takes the CDS data model and applies it to SQLite as a live database:

cds deploy --to sqlite:sqlite.db

 

 

 
 

Embedding Process and Data Preparation

The tables above form the data infrastructure of the application.
In the next step, the product text must be embedded and transferred to the vector index table.

This process takes place in two stages:

1 Converting product descriptions to embeddings 2 Loading
embeddings into the table for quick searchProductVectors

For this purpose, I added two helper scripts to the project:

 
/tools
 ‚îú‚îÄ embed.js          
 ‚îî‚îÄ init-vectors.js
 
These scripts are run once before the application runs and prepare the RAG infrastructure.

 

What is Embedding? 

Embedding is the process of converting text into a vector of numbers. In other words, it's a way of mathematically representing
text, words, or product descriptions .

try {
  require("dotenv").config();
} catch (e) {}
const cds = require("@sap/cds");
const { GoogleGenerativeAI } = require("@google/generative-ai");

async function embed(text) {
  const KEY = process.env.GEMINI_API_KEY;
  const genAI = new GoogleGenerativeAI(KEY);
  const model = genAI.getGenerativeModel({ model: "text-embedding-004" });
  const res = await model.embedContent(text);
  return res?.embedding?.values || [];
}

(async () => {
  const db = await cds.connect.to("db");
  const products = await db.run(`SELECT sku, name FROM data_Products`);
  for (const p of products) {
    const text = `${p.sku} ${p.name}`;
    const vec = await embed(text);
    await db.run(
      `INSERT OR REPLACE INTO data_ProductVectors (sku, embedding) VALUES (?, ?)`,
      [p.sku, JSON.stringify(vec)]
    );
    console.log("‚úì embedded:", p.sku);
  }
  console.log(" Bitti");
  process.exit(0);
})();
// Note: To run this file, use the following in the terminal:
//    node tools/embed.js

To run the embedding script, use the following command in the terminal:

node tools/embed.js

When this command is run, product descriptions are converted to embeddings via the Gemini API and saved in the Embeddings table. This step is only performed when data is loaded or the product list changes.

 

Passing Embeddings to Vector Lookup Table (init-vectors.js):

Once the embeddings are created, we need to load this data into the SQLite vector table for fast vector search.

At this stage, I run the init-vectors.js script.

This script: Reads the Embeddings table Converts vectors to Float32 format.

Writes to the ProductVectors table. This makes it possible to search for cosine similarity / L2 distance on SQLite.

node tools/init-vectors.js

The embeddings and vector table are ready.
At this point, let's add the plugin to the project to enable vector similarity calculation in SQLite sqlite-vec:

sqlite-extensions/
 ‚îî‚îÄ vec0.dll

This plugin adds the following functionality to SQLite:

  • vec_distance_cos() ‚Äî Cosine similarity

  • vec_distance_l2() ‚Äî L2 (Euclidean) distance

  • vec_version()‚Äî Version control

You can download it from the link below.

https://github.com/asg017/sqlite-vec/releases 

Here's how I install the plugin in Node.js:

const dll = path.resolve(__dirname, "..", "sqlite-extensions", "vec0.dll");
if (fs.existsSync(dll)) db.loadExtension(dll);
In this way the CAP service can work as an embedded vector database .

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Phase

To this point, we've prepared the application's data infrastructure, loaded the products into the system, converted them to embedding (numeric vector) format, and established a structure capable of vector searching on SQLite. Now, we're moving on to the real intelligence: the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) process.

The primary goal of the RAG approach is to prevent AI from relying solely on the model it was trained on and to enable it to produce more accurate, reliable, and contextual results by accessing real data. In this project, we implemented this as follows:

When a user types a stock-related query in natural language, the system first embeds the query and identifies the most relevant SKUs by performing a vector similarity search on SQLite-Vec. The actual records for these products are then retrieved from the SAP CAP database and provided as grounding for the Gemini model. This ensures that the AI ‚Äã‚Äãgenerates its response based solely on existing product data, eliminating any hallucinations.

R ‚Äî Retrieval (Finding information):

The query from the user ( ) queryis converted into an embedding and this embedding finds similar products using SQLite-Vec:

const qvec = await embed(query);
if (!qvec.length)
  return { error: "Embedding √ºretilemedi (Gemini).", products: [] };


const buf = toFloat32Buffer(qvec);
rows = db
  .prepare(`
    SELECT sku, vec_distance_cos(embedding, ?) AS dist
    FROM vec_product_vectors
    ORDER BY dist ASC
    LIMIT 5
  `)
  .all(buf);

In this phase, the system translates the user's natural language query into a numerical vector and returns the closest product placements based on vector similarity (cosine distance). In other words, this is where the "finding related information"
step occurs.

A ‚Äî Augmentation (Adding contextual data)

Actual product records are pulled from the CAP database using the found SKUs :

const skus = rows.map((r) => r.sku);
const products = await cds.run`
  SELECT *
  FROM data.Products
  WHERE sku in ${skus}
`;

At this point:

  • Actual commercial data (product name, price, stock, category, etc.) are taken from the system.

  • The model is now prepared to produce answers with only this data.

In other words , the Retrieval result is strengthened with real information by being ‚ÄúAugmented‚Äù .

Generation (Answer generation)

The model generates an answer based solely on the above data with the grounding rule:

const prompt = `Kullanƒ±cƒ±: "${query}"

√úr√ºn verileri (sadece bunlara dayan):
${lines}

Kurallar:
- Sadece yukarƒ±daki verilere dayan, uydurma bilgi verme.
- Kƒ±sa ve net T√ºrk√ße cevap ver.
- Eƒüer kullanƒ±cƒ± spesifik SKU/√ºr√ºn sormamƒ±≈üsa, en yakƒ±n 1-3 uygun √ºr√ºn√º √∂zetle.
`;

const answer = await callGemini(prompt);
return { content: answer };

Here:

  • The model is fed only with real data .

  • Grounding is provided with the ‚Äúdo not provide fabricated information‚Äù rule .

  • As a result, the model generates a reliable and context-based response.

RESULT:

With this project, we transformed a traditional inventory management application running on SAP CAP into an intelligent decision support system based on real data. Thanks to embedding, vector search, grounding, and Gemini integration, users can now search for products using natural language, and the model generates reliable and consistent answers based solely on existing corporate data. This approach provides a concrete example of how to improve processes with AI in businesses.

Gƒ∞THUB: https://github.com/furkanaksy838/Stock-asistan.git

entry.title: High CPU Load(100%) every minute in ERP environment with 130 Users
entry.content:
Hello specialists! 

We have a problem with a customers sql anywhere 17 database. 

Since the beginning of the year we have the case that our ERP Customer has Problems with CPU Peaks (100%). The peaks will come about every 60 seconds and last four about 10 - 20 seconds. 

What we have done already: 

- Unload and reload the databases (moren than 4 times). 

- CREATE STATISTICS all tables every night.

- Deactivating Triggers 

- Disabling new Software Features we brought in through the year. 

 

Nothing helped. Sometimes it runs smooth for an amount of days (in the beginning sometimes for weeks). Sometimes it comes back the next work day. 

Any help how to get rid of the problem would be nice ! 

Hope someone can help us. 

Greetz

Nik

entry.title: SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration ‚Äì Cloud based ERP Synchronization of Technical Objects
entry.content:
SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration (BNAC) is a cloud-based Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution hosted on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP). It enables seamless collaboration among all stakeholders involved in the lifecycle of physical assets‚Äîsuch as component suppliers, manufacturers, operators, and service providers.
At the core of BNAC lies a centralized repository that maintains digital twins (digital replicas) of physical assets. Acting as a kind of "social network for assets," BNAC facilitates real-time sharing of asset-related data, including technical specifications, documentation, and maintenance activities.
By supporting this networked collaboration model, BNAC enhances transparency, operational reliability, and asset performance, while also helping organizations reduce maintenance costs and improve safety. It integrates tightly with SAP S/4HANA, SAP Intelligent Asset Management, and SAP Fieldglass, offering a unified platform for asset data governance and cross-organizational maintenance coordination.
More information about SAP BNAC can be found here.

In today‚Äôs interconnected asset management landscape, synchronization between cloud applications and backend ERP systems is critical. BNAC serves as a key platform for managing technical objects like Equipment and Functional Locations. However, until recently, synchronization from BNAC to ERP (S/4 HANA or ECC) could only occur during the object creation process. If ERP details were not entered at that time, there was no option to sync the object afterward, often resulting in data silos and manual workarounds.
To enhance the integration process, SAP has introduced a cloud-based ERP synchronization control for technical objects (Equipment and Functional Location) that allows users to trigger synchronization both during and after object creation. This enhancement provides greater flexibility, reduces errors, and supports a more dynamic and user-driven approach to maintaining synchronized data across systems.

In this blog post, we‚Äôll:

  • Explore the challenges of the earlier synchronization process,
  • Walk through the new cloud-based ERP sync functionality, and
  • Highlight how it enhances data integrity, flexibility, and efficiency across the BNAC and ERP environments.

Note - This blog post focuses on technical objects that are owned by an organization ‚Äî specifically, those created within its own BNAC tenant. It does not cover received technical objects, i.e., technical objects that have been shared with the organization by an external organization. While many of the functionalities and principles discussed here are largely applicable to received technical objects as well, their management and behavior may vary depending on ownership and sharing configurations. These aspects will be explored in greater detail in an upcoming blog post dedicated to the handling of received/shared technical objects.

The Challenge with Existing Synchronization Process

Before the introduction of cloud-based control for ERP synchronization in SAP BNAC, the synchronization process was tightly coupled with the initial creation of technical objects. When creating an equipment or functional location in BNAC, users were required to enter ERP system details if they intended for the object to be replicated in the ERP backend system.

This presented several challenges:

  • No Post-Creation Sync Option: If ERP details were not provided during object creation, there was no option to trigger synchronization at a later stage. The object would remain in BNAC only, with no way to push it to ERP afterward.
  • Risk of Incomplete or Incorrect Data: Users often create objects incrementally or collaboratively. The requirement to include ERP details upfront increases the risk of entering incomplete or placeholder data just to initiate sync, leading to errors downstream.
  • Limited Flexibility for Business Processes: In many real-world scenarios, ERP integration decisions or assignments are finalized after the object is created. The lack of post-creation sync capability forced users to recreate objects or manage duplicate data. 

New Cloud-Based Control for ERP Synchronization

SAP BNAC now offers a powerful enhancement that significantly improves the process of synchronizing technical objects (Equipment and Functional Locations) with SAP ERP.

This enhanced capability empowers users to:

  • Avoid common synchronization bottlenecks
  • Maintain accurate and consistent asset data
  • Seamlessly align technical objects from BNAC to ERP systems ‚Äî all within a flexible cloud environment

This enables retrospective ERP synchronization, eliminating the need to recreate technical objects when the ERP system details are not provided during object creation, and supporting better lifecycle management of these technical objects.

With this mechanism, users now have greater flexibility and full control over when and how technical objects are synchronized with ERP:

  • During Object Creation: Users can continue to provide ERP system details while creating the object in BNAC. If all required fields are correctly filled, synchronization is triggered automatically as the existing synchronization process.
  • Post-Creation Synchronization: Objects created without ERP details are no longer prevented from synchronization. Users can now edit existing objects in BNAC to add the required ERP system information and mandatory fields. Once these details are provided, synchronization to the connected ERP system can be manually triggered, allowing greater flexibility and control over the data integration process.

To support the cloud-based ERP synchronization process, three new fields have been introduced in both the Object Creation dialog and the ERP Information section in BNAC UI:

  • ERP System ‚Äì Mandatory (When selecting an ERP system for a Functional Location, the user will also be prompted to choose the corresponding Structure Indicator.)
  • Category ‚Äì Mandatory
  • Proposed ERP ID ‚Äì Optional
    The Proposed ERP ID field allows users to specify a custom ID for creating the object in SAP ERP. The behavior of this field varies slightly between Equipment and Functional Location.
    For Equipment: By default, equipment in SAP ERP is created using internally generated number. The Proposed ERP ID will be used only if external numbering is enabled in ERP for the selected equipment category. This is controlled through SPRO configuration for external number ranges and MAIF (SAP Mobile Add-on) configuration for equipment-related settings. If Proposed ERP ID is populated, this value will be used for equipment creation in ERP. Else, the Equipment ID from BNAC will be used for equipment creation.
    For Functional Location: If Proposed ERP ID is populated, this value will be used for Functional Location creation in ERP. Else, the ERP system will use the Functional Location ID for Functional Location creation in ERP.

For successful synchronization of a technical object from BNAC to ERP, the ERP System and Category fields are required.
Note - Always validate that the ERP fields are populated correctly before triggering sync to avoid errors or failed replication in ERP.

The triggering of ERP synchronization for an object can be controlled using the ‚ÄúSAP ERP Synchronization‚Äù toggle available in the object creation dialog for Equipment or Functional Location.

  • When the toggle is set to ‚ÄúYes‚Äù and mandatory ERP fields are populated, the object will be synchronized with SAP ERP immediately upon creation.
  • When the toggle is set to ‚ÄúNo‚Äù, the initial ERP sync with object creation will be skipped. Users can later initiate synchronization manually from BNAC after populating the mandatory ERP fields.   
    In this case, a Sync button will appear in the ERP Information section, allowing users to trigger ERP synchronization for the technical object at their convenience. When the Sync button is pressed, a pop-up will appear prompting the user to confirm whether they also want to synchronize the object‚Äôs associated hierarchy.
    If the checkbox is selected, ERP synchronization will be triggered for the main object and, also for all related technical objects beneath it in the BNAC hierarchy. Note: ERP synchronization for an object of the hierarchy will not be triggered if its category is missing, or if the external system is absent or does not match the main object.

Post-Creation Sync: Key Points to Remember

  • When the Sync button is pressed without the Hierarchy Sync option, it triggers the ERP synchronization process for the selected ERP system for the main technical object.
  • When the Sync button is pressed with the Hierarchy Sync option selected, it triggers the ERP synchronization process for the main technical object and all related objects beneath it in the hierarchy. The hierarchy will be created in ERP only if all objects within the structure are assigned to the same ERP system. Please note that an object will not be synchronized with ERP if it is linked to a different ERP system than the main technical object. Additionally, all objects must have the category field populated for successful synchronization.
  • Once the Sync button is pressed, it will be removed from the BNAC UI. Any subsequent updates to the BNAC object will be automatically synchronized with the ERP system.
  • If the initial synchronization fails in ERP and no external ID is generated for the technical object, no further events will be sent to ERP for that object and, ERP synchronization cannot be re-triggered. Please ensure all required ERP fields are correctly populated in BNAC before triggering the ERP synchronization.

Required SAP Notes and ERP Configurations for Cloud-Based Synchronization

To enable and use the new cloud-based ERP synchronization mechanism, the following prerequisites must be met in the ERP system:
SAP Note Implementation

  • Ensure that SAP Note 3500076 is implemented in your ERP system.
  • Complete all associated manual activities as outlined in the note to avoid integration issues.

MAIF (Mobile Add-on) Configuration
To support cloud-based synchronization, the following configurations must be maintained in the MAIF (Mobile Add-on) configuration panel - transaction /SYCLO/CONFIGPANEL:

  • Enable Cloud-Based ERP Synchronization by updating the relevant mobile data object settings under Mobile Data Object Configuration section.

    For Equipment - 

     For Functional Location - 

  • Add new SYNC event for equipment and functional location to listen for synchronization events triggered by the cloud-based ERP sync feature under oData Mobile Data Object Configuration section.

     

Benefits of the New Synchronization Capability

  • Increased flexibility ‚Äì Sync technical objects when ready, not just during creation
  • Reduced rework ‚Äì No need to delete and recreate objects due to missed ERP info
  • Improved data consistency ‚Äì Aligned records across BNAC and ERP
  • Streamlined governance ‚Äì Centralized control of asset lifecycle across systems
  • Better user experience ‚Äì Simplified, intuitive sync management for end users

Best Practices & Recommendations

To get the most value from the new cloud-based synchronization capabilities in SAP BNAC, it‚Äôs important to follow a few best practices. These guidelines can help ensure successful integration with ERP systems and promote clean, reliable asset data.

  • Creation-Time Sync: Use this approach when ERP system details and required data fields are available at the time of object creation. This ensures the technical object is immediately created in ERP, avoiding delays and enabling early integration with maintenance or planning processes.
  • Post-Creation Sync: Ideal when ERP details are not yet finalized or when object creation is initiated by a user who may not have ERP access. Post-creation sync allows flexibility while still maintaining system integrity and ensures collaboration doesn't stall due to incomplete initial data.
  • Data Validation before Sync: It is essential to validate that all mandatory fields are completed according to business requirements before triggering ERP synchronization. Additionally, field values must comply with ERP data standards, such as value lists and classification types. Document links or attachments should be accessible and relevant, and hierarchies need to be logically structured with the same external system assigned to all components to ensure a successful hierarchy synchronization.

Summary

The introduction of cloud-based control of ERP synchronization in SAP BNAC marks a significant step forward in flexible, user-driven integration of technical objects across the asset lifecycle. By enabling synchronization both during and after object creation, SAP has empowered users to manage equipment and functional locations with greater autonomy and precision.
This enhancement promotes better data consistency, reduces rework, and supports smoother collaboration between asset stakeholders and ERP systems like SAP S/4HANA or ECC.

entry.title: Cannot find the Parallel line workspace in CBC
entry.content:
After requesting the parallel line tenant creation the parallel line workspace is not available in the CBC. Why I cannot see the already created parallel line workspace?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Cannot find the Parallel line workspace in CBC
entry.content:
Your user is probably not assigned to the Parallel Line Workspace (Settings -> Teams).

You can ask to the Program Manager to add yourself to the workspace. Or, you can assign SAP_CBC_CONSUMPTION_PROJECT_LEAD role to yourself and then you should be able to see the PL line.

You can refer to Standard Roles and Authorizations | SAP Help Portal 

It's important to add the role SAP_CBC_CONSUMPTION_PROJECT_LEAD instead of SAP_CBC_CONSUMPTION_PROGRAM_LEAD(Program Manager), otherwise you might not be able to see the conflict tab later. You can refer to the KBA 3661733 - Conflicts tab is raising authorization error

entry.title: SAP CPI - IBMMQ adapter setup MQRC_JSSE_ERROR.
entry.content:
I need help understanding why IBM MQ adapter in CPI does not connect to MQ server due to SSL/TLS problems with MQRC_JSSE_ERROR.

Using WebSphere MQ 9.3.0.5 on Windows.

Steps to setup:
1. Create self-signed cert on MQ Server, 

runmqakm -keydb -create -db srt04684.kdb -pw <secret> -type cms -stash

runmqakm -cert -create -db srt04684.kdb  -pw <secret> -label ibmwebspheremqqm1010t -dn "CN=srt04684,C=SE"  -size 2048  -x509version 3 -expire 730 -sig_alg SHA256WithRSA

runmqakm -cert -extract -db srt04684.kdb -pw <secret> -label ibmwebspheremqqm1010t -target srt04684.arm -format ascii

2. Config QMGR, including copying certificate files to /ssl directory and updating QMGR SSL key repository (excluding .kbd), setting the password and also setting the certificate label to "ibmwebspheremqqm1010t"

3. Create SVRCONN channel SAPISCLIENT.CH, set CipherSpec to "TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256" (have tried multiple others). No SSL Authentication.

4. Restart QMGR

5.Config cloud connector, with virtual name matching the servername "srt04684", port 1414. Verified connectivity

6. Added public Cert that was exported in MQ server to SAP CPI keystore. Named it "srt04684".

7. Created iFlow with the following parameters in IBMMQ Sender subscribe:

Hostname: srt04684
Port: 1414
Proxy type: Om Premise
SSL Cipher Suite: TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
QueueManagerName: QM1010T
Channel name: SAPISCLIENT.CH

Error on CPI:

[CONTENT][CONTENT_DEPLOY][RuntimeError] : {"message":"POLL_FAILED","childMessageInstances":[{"message":"EXCEPTION","parameters":["org.apache.camel.CamelException: Error message: An error occurred while starting or stopping JMS Connection. Reason: JMSCMQ0001: IBM MQ call failed with compcode '2' ('MQCC_FAILED') reason '2397' ('MQRC_JSSE_ERROR').."]}],"parameters":["IBMMQ://JMS_SUBSCRIBE?authentication=none&ccsid=1208&channelName=SAPISCLIENT.CH&cipherSuitCloudConn=TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256&connectionProtocol=tcpip&delay=300000&entit ... [truncated

I have also tried to create a certificate with CN=qm1010t but not succeeded with that.
I have tried multiple SSL Cipher values including *ANY, *TLS12ORHIGHER,  and others...

Any help is appreciated.

Regards
Andreas

entry.title: Re: Employee Filtering in ‚ÄúManage Teams and Responsibilit...
entry.content:
Good day @MuratTnrkt 

Thank you for your question.

Have a lok at these references for more details.

Resource Scheduling, Manage Teams and Responsibilities, Implementing Data Replication from Employee

Central, Integration with Business Partner

Based on your description, it seems there is a missing linkage between the workforce data and the data you have maintained in your Business partner.

In summary, the app does not display all Business Partners but only your active workforce persons who meet some predefined conditions such as:

  • Having an active employment record in the Workforce Person master.
  • Are linked to a valid Business Partner (Employee Role _ BUP003).
  • Have a valid organisational assignment within the current date range.
  • Are integrated through the Workforce Integration (SAP_COM_0107) scenario or maintained through Manage Workforce.

To Identify who appears and why they do,

Ensure you compare the data in Manage Workforce against Maintain Business Partner

Ensure each BP is linked to a workforce Person ID, and confirm that the employment is active and valid for today‚Äôs date.

You also have the possibility if needed, to use the CDS views I_WorkforcePerson and I_BusinessPartnerWorkforceLink to create a reconciliation query.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Fiori Elements list report controller extension typescript : editFlow().getView() does not work
entry.content:
@SumitKundu: when I paste the above file into a new SAPUI5 app, then the first TypeScript error I get is: "Type 'ControllerExtension' is not generic.". Indeed, the type does not allow generics like "ControllerExtension<ExtensionAPI>". And this is true: the class does not have generics, as you can see in the documentation (https://ui5.sap.com/#/api/sap.ui.core.mvc.ControllerExtension) and also in the UI5 type definitions. When I remove the <ExtensionAPI> part, then this.getView() works fine. 

I do see discussions like https://github.com/SAP/open-ux-tools/issues/841#issuecomment-1354440504 by Fiori Elements colleagues that intend to override our type and extend it with generics. I also see such an override being added in a template in https://github.com/SAP/open-ux-tools/pull/858/files and indeed, with this hack, the this.getView() is no longer accepted.

I guess something like this is in place in your app. I'd suggest that the Fiori Elements colleagues have a look in this case.

entry.title: Re: Employee Filtering in ‚ÄúManage Teams and Responsibilit...
entry.content:
Hello @MuratTnrkt ,

In Responsibility Management, a team member is a business user (business partner associated with an SAP user).

The Status of a business partner should not be:

  • Blocked

  • Marked for Archiving

  • Business Purpose Completed

For more details please check the below links: 
For Public Cloud:  https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/fba4dcd4eda34073afbdc3248852d7a3.html?locale=en-US
For Private Cloud: 
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/8308e6d301d54584a33cd04a9861bc52/fba4dcd4eda34073afbdc3248852d7a3.html?locale=en-US
If you have any further questions, please raise a low priority incident on component CA-GTF-RM.

entry.title: Re: SAP Integration Solution Advisory Methodology available at SAP Help Portal

Hello @KatrinVonAhsen,

I wanted to request below improvements to ISA-M, can you have a look? Happy to invest time in this and help.

  1. I see a need to update the methodology to be ready for Agents and Agent2Agent, also MCP as similar to API
  2. We updated your methodology and added a Domain OnPremise2Cloud next to Cloud2OnPremise, because this allows us to think on Network level what needs to be done. We see Network a pitfall to slow integration delivery down, so this obligates people to think about it in advance.

Thanks,
Wouter

entry.title: Re: manager user not shown
entry.content:
Dear Javokhir_Isroilov,

In order to manage manager user in On Premise environment please follow steps described in SAP Note
2801108 - Cloud Password Reset Process Must Be Initiated Before Moving a Database to On-Premise Environment.
Before proceeding with the transfer, please update the password for the user 'manager' as described in the SAP Note mentioned above. Without completing this step, there will be no Super User account available in SAP Business One in the on-premise environment.
 
I hope this helps.
 
Kind regards,
Ladislav
SAP Support
